notes.text:
# Remoted in to IT360RADIUS via SC
# Server observations
1\. Operating system is Windows Server 2016
2\. Domain joined to IT360\.local
3\. Server roles installed
a. Network Policy and Access Services \(NPS\)
b. DirectAccess and VPN \(RAS\)
c. IIS
4\. NPS configured for the following clients

![\[image\]](https://connect.it360.co.nz/v4_6_release/api/inlineimages/it360nz/9117e6f9-3b22-4a7c-b777-d1f252c0455e)

5\. WatchGuard VPN integration
SSL VPN - Active Directory
IKE2 VPN - Radius
6\. No other applications installed
# Recommendations: 
1\. WIFI Radius issues when certificate is not in use for Windows 11 computers\. ITG documentation is required to be created for the license renewal \(same as the doc for ODH - https://it360\.itglue\.com/786165/docs/11839340\)
2\. Need to discuss the type of Watchguard VPN to be used for IT360\. If we are using both, it is required to have a Radius server
3\. Perform in-place upgrade of the OS

- Review and comment to Ryan
- Upgrade and optimisation recommendations for IT360RADIUS look good overall. A couple of questions:
1. Do we know who actively uses each type of VPN?
2. If not, is VPN use easily obtainable in WG logs or config, or do you want to reach out to the team?

- Runs authentication for iT360
  - Wifi 
  - VPN
- RYAN to investigate how else these services can be authenticated moving forward

Assigned / RyanMag / Hi Ryan,

If you need to log any time for replacing or upgrading the IT360RADIUS server you can put it against this ticket.

Ngā mihi
James

ticket.summary: Configure SSO via Entra ID for Google Services
Mature MFA and SSPR to Authentication Methods in Entra ID

notes.text:
Hey James,

Could you please clarify what you need from me on this one? 

I believe Microsoft Auth is already the primary, but is it enforcement of this being the only/primary method without any other option? If so, may need you to supply the documentation for that.

SSPR, I can set this up, but can you explain what the requirement is - aka the "not for login" bit

Thanks!

Research auth methods and current MFA and SSPR config.

Logging the following CR:
Enable Authentication Methods in Entra in preparation for move away from legacy MFA and SSPR management portals.
In Entra ID under Identity | Protection | Authentication Methods
- Passkey \(FIDO2\) settings
 - ENABLE with defaults
- Microsoft Authenticator
 - ENABLE
  - Use defaults in Enable and Target tab
  - Under Configure tab
   - ENABLE '**Show application name**'
   - ENABLE '**Show geographic location'**
   - DISABLE '**Microsoft Authenticator on companion apps**' 
- Temporary Access Pass
 - ENABLE with defaults
- Hardware OATH tokens
 - ENABLE with defaults
- Third-party software OATH tokens
 - ENABLE with defaults
- Prep comms for users and TCoE.

- Enabled the following:

In Entra ID under Identity | Protection | Authentication Methods
* Passkey \(FIDO2\) settings
* ENABLE with defaults
* Microsoft Authenticator
* ENABLE
* Use defaults in Enable and Target tab
* Under Configure tab
* ENABLE 'Show application name'
* ENABLE 'Show geographic location'
* DISABLE 'Microsoft Authenticator on companion apps'
* Temporary Access Pass
* ENABLE with defaults
* Hardware OATH tokens
* ENABLE with defaults
* Third-party software OATH tokens
* ENABLE with defaults
Inform users of upcoming Microsoft Authenticator registration campaign. Plan deployment. Consider "System-preferred multifactor authentication" and "Report suspicious activity" options.

- Raise CR and email staff re MFA registration campaign
- Research passwordless login options

* Enable SMS for SSPR \(but NOT for login\) as long as an additional factor is required for SSPR.

ticket.summary: Establish Password Change Regime for Infrastructure
Enforce and monitor firewall status on workstations and networks

notes.text:
After some reading, seems like the best way to handle this is via group policy and/or intune. Couldn't see an easy way to track this via Ninja but perhaps Si or Chris have some ideas so I could pull them in

Have a couple of questions though

1\. Does this include servers, if so, will need to get Vic involved to confirm this is fine to force
2\. When you say "Monitor Firewall Status" is this just monitoring "On vs off" or is there anything else that needs to be monitored

Thanks

- Meeting with JK to determine current status of FW config and monitoring

Proposed Windows Firewall monitoring/enforcement plan:
 
**Servers**
* Monitor all - and alert if OFF
* Do not enforce
**Workstations**
* Monitor all - and alert if OFF
* Enforce on all workstations
* Create exception group for engineer workstations \(devices must be explicitly added to this group to enable Firewall to be locally managed\)
Hey James, I know you were planning on pushing a change control through to get the group policy enforced. Did you want me to create one or will you need to draft the plan?
Working on Microsoft Defender for endpoint set-up
Setting up defender and compliance policies for IT360 - next step is to set up hybrid join so devices can be managed in the cloud

Hi Jono,

Great questions.

1. Cool. GPO/Intune make the most sense. Would be worth asking Si only for the scenario where a device might not be connected to either AD or Entra.
2. Servers – Yes, but rather than thinking of it as ‘forcing’, I would use the perspective of ‘centrally managing’. That is rather than setting policies on the server itself, it is deployed and updated via GPO. Primarily the ON/OFF config…but if Vic wanted to, we could even get down to the individual policy level…however my thoughts are that might be too labour intensive.
3. ON / OFF monitoring is fine for now.

Ngā mihi

James Robinson
Senior Cyber Security Consultant

Hi Jono,

Happy for you to do this, when you're back.

_info.notes:
After some reading, seems like the best way to handle this is via group policy and/or intune. Couldn't see an easy way to track this via Ninja but perhaps Si or Chris have some ideas so I could pull them in

Have a couple of questions though

1. Does this include servers, if so, will need to get Vic involved to confirm this is fine to force
2. When you say "Monitor Firewall Status" is this just monitoring "On vs off" or is there anything else that needs to be monitored

Thanks

- Meeting with JK to determine current status of FW config and monitoring

Proposed Windows Firewall monitoring/enforcement plan:
 
Servers
 Monitor all - and alert if OFF
 Do not enforce
Workstations
 Monitor all - and alert if OFF
 Enforce on all workstations
 Create exception group for engineer workstations (devices must be explicitly added to this group to enable Firewall to be locally managed)
Hey James, I know you were planning on pushing a change control through to get the group policy enforced. Did you want me to create one or will you need to draft the plan?
Working on Microsoft Defender for endpoint set-up
Setting up defender and compliance policies for IT360 - next step is to set up hybrid join so devices can be managed in the cloud

ticket.summary: Enable MFA on Kaseya Quote Manager

notes.text:
Hey guys,

I don't have access to the Kaseya quote manager admin center it seems, so I can't manage the MFA settings unfortunately. Could I be given access or can this be assigned to someone else?

- Test KQM SSO access. All good.
- Add all KQM users to KaseyaOne
- Adjust KQM config to require SSO for all but excepted users. Except all but myself. Test. OK
- Adjust K1 config to require SSO for all but excepted users. Except all but myself. Test. OK
- Confirm K1 users and communicate re activation of M365 SSO
- Enable auto mapping of SSO groups
- Enable User role as default for SSO users. Found this demoted my admin account to User, removing my Master priviledges
- Work with DW to regain access
- Log ticket with Kaseya
- Document auth and access
- User comms and planning for enforcement of login via KQM...which in turn uses M365.

- User comms
- Documentation
  - [Kaseya Quote Manager / Datto Commerce / Gluh — IT Glue](https://it360.itglue.com/19904/assets/483-applications/records/72378482)
  - [Documents - Kaseya Quote Manager - Access and Authentication \(itglue.com\)](https://it360.itglue.com/19904/docs/17573767#version=published&documentMode=view)
- Disable direct login for Shannon, Iain, Campbell, and Accounts
- Assess remaining users and plan final activations

- Work with Callum to ensure he can log in with MFA
- Disable non-MFA-based login on KQM for both Callum and Ruth.
- Message Ruth re the change.

[@Dave](mailto:David.Wilson@iT360.co.nz), do you have any concerns with us providing Jono this access for the duration of this config improvement?

Ngā mihi

James Robinson
Senior Cyber Security Consultant
[Book a meeting with me here.](https://calendly.com/james-robinson-it360/)
